questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate the Lusaka - Mongu road;
(b) if so, when the project will commence; and
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to procure malaria vaccines;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) how many doses of the vaccine are earmarked for procurement;
(d) what the total cost of procuring the vaccines is;
(e) how efficacious the vaccines are; and
(f) when the vaccine will be rolled out, countrywide.

(c) what the estimated cost of preventing the expansion of the gully is.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development and Sanitation

(i) Chisale; (ii) Nthambo; (iii) Walira; and (iv) Mzime; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the proposed restructuring of Zesco Limited will lead to job losses at the power utility company; and

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure,Housing and Urban Development

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to tar the following roads in Magoye Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Magoye - Chivuna; and (ii) Nziba - Itebe;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 75) W9. Mr Chanda (Kanchibiya) - to ask the Minister of Small and Medium Enterprise Development:
(a) what measures the Government is taking to ensure that Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) are linked to international markets so that they are not exploited by large enterprises;
(b) what measures the Government is taking to promote value addition and market linkages for SMEs engaged in the production of the following, in Kanchibiya Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) groundnuts;         (iv) chibwa salt; and (ii) rice;                     (v) caterpillars; and (iii) beans;
(c) which areas in the Constituency are earmarked for the creation of industrial hubs for SMEs. W10. Mr Mtayachalo (Chama North) - to ask the Minister of Agriculture:
(a) how much rice is produced in Zambia annually;
(b) how much is imported;
(c) whether the Government has any plans to increase rice production in Chama District and other parts of the country;
(d) if so, what the plans are; and

(e) when the Government expects to attain self-sufficiency in rice production. PRESENTATION OF GOVERNMENT BILL The Minister of Justice The National Prosecution Authority (Amendment) – Bill to amend the National Prosecution Authority Act, 2010. (N.A.B 7/2023)
